paragraphs: The police of the city of Karlovy Vary easily found two thieves who broke into someone else's apartment on the evening of August 9th and stole valuable items from it. One of the burglars inadvertently helped the investigators by leaving a bag-purse at the crime scene, which contained his ID card (občanský průkaz), insurance policy, and various loyalty program cards.

"On Saturday around 18:00, two men approached one of the buildings where they noticed a partially open window. Through it, they entered the apartment, from which they stole a gaming console with accessories, two rings, and a memory card with a total value of about 20,000 kroner."

When the owner returned home, he noticed both men sitting on the stairs at the entrance to the building. Upon entering the apartment, he immediately saw that the window was wide open, and valuable items were missing from the room.

When the victim went out onto the street, the suspects were no longer there. However, they forgot a bag at the scene, which contained the identification of one of the suspects, an insurance policy, and loyalty cards.

The victim reported the incident to the emergency line 158 and provided a detailed description of one of the men. The police immediately began a search and within a few minutes apprehended both suspects near the house with the stolen items," said law enforcement representative Jan Bilek.

Now the detained residents of the Karlovy Vary region face up to three years in prison for theft and violation of the inviolability of the home. Previously, they had already been convicted of property crimes.
